intro: Hieracium obovoideum, commonly known as the broad-ovate hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are broadly ovate with a rough texture, and the flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is often found in moist environments and can form dense colonies, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
